description: Classifies email as work-relevant vs spurious (ads, solicitations, vendor spam, newsletters)
prompt_template:
Classify this email as WORK-RELEVANT or SPURIOUS.

An email is SPURIOUS if it is:
- Marketing emails, newsletters, promotional content
- Vendor solicitations, sales pitches, cold outreach
- Job postings, recruiting emails from unknown recruiters
- Automated monitoring/build notifications NOT related to your work
- Out-of-office replies, delivery failures, bounce messages
- Conference announcements, event invites from unknown senders
- News digests, industry updates, blog subscriptions

An email is WORK-RELEVANT if it is:
- Project discussions, technical conversations, code reviews
- Team communications, 1-on-1s, meeting invitations from colleagues
- Decisions, approvals, reviews, work requests
- Direct questions or assignments from team members
- Automated reports YOU own (your dashboards, your services)
- Internal company communications about your projects

EMAIL TO CLASSIFY:

Subject: {subject}
From: {sender_email} ({sender_name})
To: {recipients}
Delivery Date: {delivery_date}

Body Preview:
{body_snippet}

---

RESPOND ONLY WITH VALID JSON:

{
  "classification": "WORK_RELEVANT" or "SPURIOUS",
  "confidence": 0.85,
  "reasoning": [
    "Signal 1: Brief explanation",
    "Signal 2: Brief explanation"
  ]
}

reasoning: Body contains marketing content, no work discussion
